Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
@Steve Lee hey Steve I know you've got new templates/themes you want to use for Komodo updates, announcements etc that have specific feel and color schemes.

I think we should make one specifically for coin announcements getting listed on BarterDEX. I tried doing this a while back but the updates of new coins seemed spaced out and made distribution of any marketing material difficult/last minute. I was thinking we could have a pre made template with komodo logos and listing announcement etc and when coins put their info in on Github to be listed, they can give their logo and the email address of whoever runs their social media, and we simply add their logo to the graphic and email it to their social media person saying, "hey here's our official announcement poster, your coin should be supported on X day, feel free to post this to your Twitter and tag us and we'll retweet!"

The github request makes it so we can reach out into other coin communities and get unique impressions. 

"Adding a coin got much easier.¬†Any new coin add request now ONLY has to go to this repository:¬†https://github.com/jl777/coins."

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Thoughts anyone?

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we just discussed this today in a meeting

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we're setting up a process so we're updated on new integrations and we will collect and announce

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Collect and announce?

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: not per coin, like batch updates

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: weekly or monthly. we're figuring out what the best process would be for meaningful  updates

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I mean us announcing it I feel will only get it out to our own followers. Wouldn't per coin be more effective at outreach? A small cap coin that gets listed is probably going to be less receptive to tweeting to their followers that they are 1 of 20 coins to be added.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: It's of course more work, which is why I suggested having a simple Komodo template where we slap the logo they provided us on it, and send their social media email the poster to tweet.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Those five points are a good summary towards investors.

We are about to announce 5 technology pillars (security, scalability, interoperability, privacy, simplicity) that we hope would make it easy to understand what we are trying to offer. These pillars are directed more towards businesses / entreprise / developers to which we want to sell our Komodo Assetchain technology.

I would love to market Agama Wallet more, but for that to happen our team needs to finalize PEN testing and then we it would deserve its own landing page. We might actually soon have something cool to announce as Steve has been talking with one Agency who is going to help us build THE BEST multi-coin wallet on the industry. I heard from Steve these guys are really exited about Komodo üòÉ

Author: Audo#5667
Content: Mentioning Agama Wallet + HyperDEX is going to be 10x more powerful once we have a polished product + website. HyperDEX team is working hard to make the official launch and as said we are also looking to take our Agama Wallet to the next level üòÉ

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
My elevator pitch for KMD is... 

> Komodo is an end-to-end technology provider with a vision of building an interoperable ecosystem. With Komodo you can host your own infrastructure and connect your project into the whole ecosystem, including a multi-coin wallet and decentralized exchange. The Komodo blockchain offers security and interoperability services for all the other blockchains on our ecosystem.

Something like that... what do you guys think?

If I would be talking to an investor perhaps I would highlight how Komodo is the base currency of the entire ecosystem, and that you get 5 % rewards and good privacy.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: Yes, HyperDEX team did a soft-launch. For official launch they will have website and everything.

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
Since Komodo offers very wide range of technologies we have concluded to talk about 'end-to-end technology'. I guess 'blockchain' is the standard term everyone uses to refer to the technology. Even wider term would be 'ledger technology'. I haven't came up with any other term that could hold all our tech inside it.

The best option in my mind would be to talk about "Blockchain as a Service", "Infrastructure as a Service" or "Platform as a Service"... but we are little concerned to promise this as currently we have a DIY model. For now we are just providing technology, there is no service to sell. If we would mention service then many businesses would assume we offer a lot more than pure technology.

Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content: It's very clear, and I think it's very important to really explain that the big difference of komodo with other blockchain platforms is that on Komodo you can create your own completely independent blockchain. people have trouble understanding this

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
yeah they do. Even when I explain that "with Komodo you get your own blockchain" or "native blockchain" .... most people don't understand what  I mean by that. 

Thus now I prefer to tell them that "with Komodo you can host your own infrastructure and not be dependent on a public blockchain". That makes our benefits more clear, but I'm afraid that then we have the problem of making a distinction with a private permissioned blockchain. At least the moment we only provide public permissionless blockchains.
